Hi Milt;

I don't think so.  

They made some very good tsuba.  

I put their average work on  par with the Waki Goto average work.  

Now having said that, there were some very good swords made by the Bungo group also.  

John 
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: bungotakadasword 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, April 16, 2006 12:14 PM
  Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: in defense of the ugly bird or seeking more " punishment "


  -t,
  the Ko-kinko tsuba is in the Lundgren collection book and a scan is 
  available in my photo album on the list, Pete the dentist has a better 
  scan...........

  got another question ..........
  Is the Aizu Shoami school of soft metal tsuba the " Bungo sword " of 
  the tsuba world ?....like if one is not sure what it is then chances 
  are it's an Aizu  " Shoamimono " ??

  Milt
